title: Layer of Things to do and see in the Limousin
name: Layer of Things to do and see in the Limousin

properties.name: Albussac and Les Cascades de Muriel
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1AlbussacAlbussac is situated between Tulle and Argentat amongst some of the most beautiful countryside of the region. La Franche-Valeine is an intriguing and pittoresque river, running through the trees in a peaceful calm manner. Heading further into the woods, the land becomes more rugged and suddenly the river becomes more violent and waterfalls become apparent. The river that seemed so peaceful to start with now ressembles a typical mountain river. Discover the most breath taking 360-degree views from climbing a few meters; it is certainly worth it! How to find Les Cascades de Muriel: At the village Forgès, between Tulle and Argentat, on the RN 120, follow the signs to Albussac. Look out for the signs featuring waterfalls, which will take you to a car park. From thereon you will find footpaths

properties.name: Arboretum de la Sedelle
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Villejoint A 10 hectares dale with a collection of oaks and maples, a beech grove, a topiary garden, a “garden of smells”, the green amphitheatre, a tea-house, and more…..

properties.name: Labyrinthe Geant
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Gueret The "Labyrinthe Geant" (Giant maze) situated in the heart of the massive Chabrieres forest, represents an entertaining as well as educational site: 2 hectares of grassed, rolling paths, with clues along the way to help you find the exit!

properties.name: Lac de Vassiviere
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Sandy beach, watersports, fishing etc.

properties.name: Les Jardins de la Crinaldiere
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Saint-Germain Beaupre "Les Jardins de la Crinaldiere", 4 gardens planned around a 15th-17th manor : More than 300 species of bush and a collection of willows. Information: 05 55 63 80 99

properties.name: Les jardins Clos de la Forge
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Villejoint Seven small -enclosed gardens planted around traditional Creuse houses, including: Bower enclosure, green theatre, small fruit garden, hardy plants garden, shade garden... On October 19th 2001 "Les Jardins Clos de la Forge" received the first prize in a national competition, organised by the association of Garden and Horticulture Journalists. 43 contemporary gardens throughout France were judged, and “Les jardins Clos de la Forge” came out on top. Information: 05 55 89 82 59

properties.name: Located at Centre Touristique du Coiroux
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1A park with activities forchildren and adults including Bungee jumping. Located at Centre Touristique du Coiroux, Aubazine

properties.name: Meymac
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1MeymacMeymac is a pictoresque town full of history and beautiful architecture. Firstly, l’abbaye Saint-André-Saint-Léger, built in the XII century. Then there is the centre for contemporary art and the Hôtel-Dieu. However, it is not just the numerous buildings that make this place special since the beautiful architecture on every street corner creates an amazing peaceful atmosphere. Tourist office: 05 55 95 18 43

properties.name: Monceaux-sur-Dordogne
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Monceaux-sur-Dordogne This charming village at 4 kilometers from Argentat has a population of only 700. Monceaux-sur-Dordogne is situated on the banks of the river Dordogne and caters for tourists in the summer offering open-air activities on the river, such as water sports and fishing. It is the perfect spot for bird watching or for painting and drawing. There are six campsites in and around the village for the large number of tourists that are attracted to the area every year

properties.name: Oradour sur Glane, Centre de la Memoire
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Centre dedicated to the massacre of 642 men, women and children that took place in the town of Oradour-sur-Glane on 10th June 1944. The ruins of the village have been kept as a permanent memorial to those that perished at the hands of the SS Panzer division.

properties.name: Saillac
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1SaillacThis is what la Corrèze is all about… a diverse countryside and atmosphere attracting so many tourists every year. Saillac is a village with the character and charm described at length in the work of writer Marcel Pagnol. It is renown for growing la Marbot- a nut with a thin shell and an amazing taste. Although it may not attract as many tourists as neighbouring towns, it is the perfect spot for peaceful walks whilst admiring the roman church and the old oil mill in the main square. Information: 05 55 25 32 25

properties.name: Saillant CK eaux vives

properties.name: Saint Geniez ô Merle
properties.description: Posted by Bernard1Saint Geniez ô MerleIn the Marlonne valley is the medieval town of Saint-Geniez-ô-Merle that plunges you into the Middle Ages. The town really does not feel as though it is in the Limousin with the dominant fortress and chateau standing tall. Here you can discover life in the Middle Ages with a farm and gardens recreated to fit in with history. At the Maison Manège there are organised work shops, exhibitions as well as a gift shop. Information: 05 55 28 22 31
